victory and triumph, generally when he was dying of wounds and the sovereign had thanked him for heroic deeds, and while dying he expressed the love his actions had proved. 
"Besides how can I ask the Emperor for his instructions for the right flank now that it is nearly four o'clock and the battle is lost? No, 
certainly I must not approach him, I must not intrude on his reflections. Better die a thou- sand times than risk receiving an unkind look or bad opinion from him," Rost6v decided; an
